===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|ぎ}}
From {{der|ja|ltc|sort=き'|蟻|tr=ngje<sup>X</sup>}}. Compare modern {{cog|yue|-}} reading ''ngai<sup>5</sup>''.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=o|ぎ}}

====Affix====
{{ja-pos|ぎ|affix}}

# [[ant]]

=====Usage notes=====
This reading is only found in compounds. When the character is used on its own, it is always read as the [[訓読み|kun'yomi]] of ''ari''.

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-l|蟻群|ぎぐん|gigun}}: a [[group]] of [[ant]]s
* {{ja-l|蟻径|ぎけい|gikei}}: a [[narrow]] [[road]] or [[path]] (from the way that ants tend to travel in [[single file]])
* {{ja-l|蟻穴|ぎけつ|giketsu}}: an [[anthill]], a [[hole]] dug by [[ant]]s; a very small [[fault]] or [[mistake]]
* {{ja-l|蟻蚕|ぎさん|gisan}}: a [[silkworm]] that has just [[hatched]] from its [[egg]] (from the superficial similarity to an ant)
* {{ja-l|蟻酸|ぎさん|gisan}}: [[formic acid]]
* {{ja-l|蟻酸塩|ぎさんえん|gisan'en}}: [[formate]]
* {{ja-l|蟻集}}, {{ja-l|蟻聚|ぎしゅう|gishū}}: a large [[grouping]], as of many ants
* {{ja-l|蟻走感|ぎそうかん|gisōkan}}: [[formication]]: a [[feeling]] as of many [[bug]]s crawling on one's skin
* {{ja-l|蟻付|ぎふ|gifu}}: a large [[grouping]] or [[gathering]] of [[people]], much as [[ant]]s will gather around something sweet
* {{ja-l|蟻封|ぎほう|gihō}}: an [[anthill]]
* {{ja-l|蟻量|ぎりょう|giryō}}: “ant-weight”: the [[weight]] of a [[silkworm]] just after [[hatching]] from its egg (see {{ja-l|蟻蚕||gisan}} above)
* {{ja-l|蟻垤|ぎてつ|gitetsu}}: an [[anthill]]
{{der-bottom}}

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|あり}}
{{unk.|ja|sort=あり}}. From {{der|ja|ojp|sort=あり|-}}, but ultimate derivation remains a mystery. There are potentially interesting similarities to {{cog|ko|아리||leg}} and {{ko-inline|아래|below, beneath}}, but evidence is lacking.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|あり|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|あり}}

# [[ant]]

=====Idioms=====
{{der-top|Idioms}}
* {{ja-l|蟻の這い出る隙間もない|ありのはいでるすきまもない|ari no haideru sukima mo nai}}: “not even a crack wide enough for an ant to crawl through” → without a gap, close, tight
* {{ja-l|蟻の熊野参り|ありのくまのまいり|ari no Kumano-mairi}}, {{ja-l|蟻の伊勢参り|ありのいせまいり|ari no Ise-mairi}}, {{ja-l|蟻の百度参り|ありのひゃくどまいり|ari no hyakudo-mairi}}, {{ja-l|蟻の堂参り|ありのどうまいり|ari no dō-mairi}}, {{ja-l|蟻の物参り|ありのものまいり|ari no mono-mairi}}: “an ants' pilgrimage to Kumano / Ise / the hundred shrines and temples / the temples / the holy sites” → a metaphor likening ants in single file to a procession of pilgrims; alternately, a metaphor for a large group of people moving in single file
* {{ja-l|蟻の一穴|ありのいっけつ|ari no ikketsu}}: “a single ant-hole” → a metaphor for the way a tiny thing can cause grave consequences; compare ''[[a stitch in time saves nine]]''
* {{ja-l|蟻の穴から堤も崩れる|ありのあなからつつみもくずれる|ari no ana kara tsutsumi mo kuzureru}}, {{ja-l|蟻の穴より堤の崩れ|ありのあなよりつつみのくずれ|ari no ana yori tsutsumi no kuzure}}: “even a dike can fall apart due to an ant-hole” → a metaphor for the way a tiny thing can cause grave consequences; compare ''[[a stitch in time saves nine]]''
* {{ja-l|蟻の甘きにつく如し|ありのあまきにつくごとし|ari no amaki ni tsuku gotoshi}}: “just like ants drawn to a sweet” → a metaphor for the way that people are drawn to profitable things; compare ''[[like a moth to a flame]]'', of nearly opposite meaning
* {{ja-l|蟻の思いも天に届く|ありのおもいもてんにとどく|ari no omoi mo ten ni todoku}}, {{ja-l|蟻の思いも天に昇る|ありのおもいもてんにのぼる|ari no omoi mo ten ni noboru}}: “even an ant's thoughts can reach / rise to the heavens” → no matter how [[humble]] or [[lowly]], if one tries hard enough, one's wishes can still be heard by the gods in heaven; compare ''[[where there's a will, there's a way]]''
* {{ja-l|蟻の塔を組む如し|ありのとうをくむごとし|ari no tō o kumu gotoshi}}: “just like building an ant tower [anthill]” → even great deeds can be accomplished through patient work; compare ''[[a journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step]]''
{{der-bottom}}

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-l|蟻の塔|ありのとう|ari no tō}}: an “ant tower” → an [[anthill]]
* {{ja-l|蟻の塔草|ありのとうぐさ|ari no tō-gusa}}: a kind of [[seaberry]], {{taxlink|Haloragis micrantha|species|noshow=1}}
* {{ja-l|蟻の塔草科|ありのとうぐさか|ari no tō-gusa ka}}: the [[seaberry]] family, {{taxlink|Haloragaceae|family|noshow=1}}
* {{ja-l|蟻の子|ありのこ|ari no ko}}: an [[ant]], particularly one without wings; an ant [[egg]] or [[larva]]
{{der-bottom}}

===Etymology 3===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|ありのこ}}
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=ありのこ|蟻|tr1=ari|t1=ant|の|tr2=no|pos2=possessive particle|子|tr3=ko|t3=child; small thing}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|ありのこ}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{ja-l|蟻の子}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|ありのこ}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=ありのこ|obsolete}} an [[ant]], particularly one without [[wing]]s
#* {{RQ:Shin'yaku Kegonkyō Ongi Shiki|161}}
#*: 蚊'''蟻''' 上可 下音疑 訓'''安利乃古'''<ref name="SKOS">{{R:Shin'yaku Kegonkyō Ongi Shiki}}</ref>
# {{lb|ja|sort=ありのこ|obsolete}} an ant [[egg]] or [[larva]]

=====Usage notes=====
The spelling of {{lang|ja|蟻}} for ''ari no ko'' is generally only seen in old texts. In modern Japanese, this term is much more commonly spelled as {{ja-l|蟻の子}}.
